page.title: 19INDUSTRY LOCAL SURVEY.
page.content: The block we surveyed was mainly agricultural land with very little present day industry.In the past, however,coalmines and clay pits were important sources of employment and these sites,now derelict,are a useful resource for industrial archaeology. Modern day industry within the survey area is limited to mechanical engineering and haulage.The two small haulage companies specialise in retail and distribution of packed food and drinks to supermarkets and local high streets.The mechanical engineering firm concentrates on the repair of delivery trucks.They are small scale employers, one employing 20 people,the other only 2. As can be seen from the above description, industrial activity plays a minor role in what is basically an agricultural community.
